title.rendered: #79 out of you shall flow rivers of living water …

content.rendered:
Out of you shall flow rivers of living water….

– Science says around 90% of the human body is made up of water…
– All the metabolic activity that takes place in our body involves water as a primary resolvent in some component form or the other …
– Not a day a passes without you and I drinking water…
– At times when there’s no water around, we get extremely thirsty and even our energy levels start to come down …

Okay – before you strangle me, i was only trying to say, water is an essential part of our life… and i think i made the point quite fine.. : – P

John 7:38 … says that rivers of Living waters will flow through all those who go to Jesus to quench their thirst …
Now, if you look at that verse real close, the word ‘streams’ was used. Now, can you imagine the size of a stream ! At times, its real big… and it never stops flowing… unless, the whole thing gets dried up …
And the other powerful word used was LIVING … now thatz reallly cool isn’t it… You call something living, when it has LIFE in it … now how on earth are we to prove that water is a living thing, and not just a thing …? The Lord was obviously relating it to something which has characteristics of both LIFE an the nature of a liquid. As in, something that has LIFE and flows…
The Living waters here mean blessings, that will satisfy our souls… We goto Him for answers/ blessings/rest so that our spirit be lifted up and our soul be satisfied … And our Lord doesn’t want us to stop there .. He wants us to inturn become a blessing for others … as in not quench our thirst, but allow these blessings to flow through us…
Have you not come across people, who just walked up to you and said,
– “thank you so much for being my friend …its so comforting to have you around”
– “thank you for the words of encouragement ”
– “thank you for listening to me… i feel so relieved ”
The very reason you are placed, wherever you are placed, could be because, the Lord wants you to be a blessing…

task : you may not understand a blessing completely unless, you yourself are blessed … so do not underestimate or be casual about matter involving people who look up to …. You must’ve heard this before, “you may be the only bible, someone might ever read” …
so go on out there and be a blessing for many …

title.rendered: #78 its a beautiful world out there …

content.rendered:
Its a beautiful world out there …
The plants/ the flowers/ the animals/ the streams (I meant in the remote areas)/ the rivers/ the sky at dawn/ the sky at dusk/ the people (remember they are all made in the Lords likeness)/ the technology (wisdom comes from Him)/ the birds/ the beautiful ladies in our work place/ the cutest nose/ the smartest hairdo/ the tallest guy/ the tallest girl / the chubbiest of ’em all/ the most wonderful smiley face/ the quietest of them all/ the most talkative/ the most funniest/  the weirdest/ the shabbiest …

All you had to do was just look around… and there’s so much beauty … In just about everything … And the Lord made it all… He made it all for us … He made it so that we could enjoy it… So that we could benefit from it …
Now, wait a second right there…! You might be struggling with a problem of your own, and see no possible scope of release ! I encourage you to sit back and use the wisdom that the Lord blessed you with, and think !!!
! Our Lord is above the flood… at this very moment, He is bigger than your problem … the last thing He wants you to do is W O R R Y … then what does He want you to do …
He wants you to P R A I S E Him … with all of your heart, mind, soul and strength …

Now, before you close this window saying, lets be real … Well I am being REAL .!!!.. God was being real when He made us … God was being real when He made the nature for us….  God was being real when He said He loved us … God was being real when He displayed it on the cross … God is being real each of those millions and millions of times He forgives us over and over and over the same sins that we commit …
So may be we should just cut the crap, and stop believing the lies of the devil … [ if you are in a pensive mood, then thatz the devil ] …
In spite of all the wrong that we do, our Lord still wants us to enter His courts boldly …
Now, wait a second… we sinners – enter the presence of the Holy One …

Thatz exactly what I am talking about … Thatz the God we serve … His mercies flow … His Grace flows …
He wants to shower you and I with His LOVE …

task : so …look around …will you …!  If we were made in His likeness, then somewhere inside us we also have the LOVE thing … pull it out … and learn to LOVE all the people around …
For that matter, start to Love that person, you just can’t stand … start to Love your bosses !!! start to LOVE that colleagues whom you dislike the most …
you needn’t display you LOVE  … but to start with,  LOVE!! … and it will, show, by default …

thatz how it works !!

the world we live in today has in it, lots of problems/ complex situations/ trials/ disorders/ crashes/ breakdowns/ downtimes… every individual (Christian/non Christian) has his own share of ’em ..

but the Lord’s way is challenging, tough, gruel some, trying … it basically will pull you out of your comfort zone …
the worldly depend upon on their own or borrowed or bought strengths / capabilities/ ideas …
on the other hand we (Christians) have access to the Main Man Himself… He has not just offered to help us, but also to take us through it all the way …!
the worldly may or may not succeed in their venture … they don’t have no guarantee of victory …
but we have our assurance in Christ Jesus… everything turns to our good, simply because we are in Him…
the worldly may seek ungodly counsel which might end up landing them trouble …
but its a different case with us … His WORD is a lamp unto our feet … if we stuck to Him there’s no way we can be mislead …!
the non-Christians may cause a lot of damage to the system/government and people and make a lot of enemies in the process of making their way through …
but through us will flow rivers of living waters that inturn will be a blessing for many …
the ways of the world may cause your character to disintegrate and also corrupt your mind and soul ..
but Jesus’ WAY can only cause your soul to flourish forever eternity long ….

With a bible in your hand and the joy of salvation in your heart, you aren’t expected to rejoice at your privileges here on earth …. of course the bible says, that you could rejoice that our names are being written on heaven …
but hello, we also have a commission … to reach out … so lets get back to work rejoicing ….

content.rendered:
contd …

Let us see why?

Its evident from the WORD that we shall not be tempted beyond what we can handle! And moreover if the Lord is able to trust you with it, what is your problem in victoring over it through Him! Its not easy! agreed … But its exciting! Now, don’t look at me as though I were insane. I’ll tell you what exactly makes life exciting… “its these trialz and tribulations and temptations … ‘cuz when you’re are going through ’em, holding Christ’s hand, you’d see the extraordinary / supernatural / out of the world / miraculous / unbelievable happening “… even as you are led to victory! …    And simply put we don’t usually have such experiences because we aren’t allowing Christ to lead us through them … !

title.rendered: #75 blessing dispatch centre … IV The divine perspective!

content.rendered:
Before you read this, I would urge you to read the previous two mails …
They covered a vintage born-again Christian’s perspective on various aspects of life …

And NOW, let us get a head towards the perspective that God wants us to have …

* First things FIRST- stop attributing blessings to the standards of this world. The truth is worldly standards don’t stand the test of time. They are bio-degradable. They are exposed to wear and tear. They don’t have a great re-sale value. They might be the in-thing in your part of the country, but up there in heaven, they don’t mean a thing.
* And Let me also add, “unless you aren’t of sound mind, and have a really bad head towards investment, you  wouldn’t really seek anything of the world!”.

* The Lord’s WORD is powerful. The WORD is full of God’s promises- Promises that were made to be kept. We don’t even have to claim those promises. [ You claim something that is lost/ stolen]. The promises were always there, all we had to do was take ’em by faith. Sight will tell you, that you will be in the same job sulking month after month, working for the same pay, under the same boss. Faith will tell you that out of you shall flow living waters, which inturn will be a blessing for many.

* If you have been praying for something real hard, and not much has been happening, then you might want to try out this little exercise. Ask yourself this question. Whatever be it that you are asking for, does it glorify God or your SELF? Check the motive behind the prayer.

* You may have CARAVAN of requests lined up – A car, a own flat, a decent job in a big-time company etc. And you may even tell yourself that, you are going to glorify God through them. Nothings wrong with your motive! Its actually wonderful that your priority is to lift His Name on high. But there is something about God’s nature that we need to understand here. His LOVE towards us is such that, all the plans/ blessings/purposes He has for us are designed in the best interest of us. i.e. He knows what is best for us and also the time when it can be best imparted on us.

* At times the blessings that we seek become so important, that they begin to determine our relationship with the Lord. They start to dictate our moods, temperament and even attitude. They allow apprehension and stress and frustration and whole lotta stuff like that to come into us. They may also take us away from God. Now, You don’t want that to happen, in your right minds. Do you?  So beloved seek Him, not the blessings. If you were thinking I am not being realistic, then I must say you are yet to taste HIM. Try Him! He is matchless. No one can beat Him. He is all that we ever need.

* Its true, that the Lord wants us to have the best of everything. Underline that statement and keep it in the back of your minds. Look forward for the best, anticipate for it! No harm. But don’t make that your primary priority. When it comes, it comes. I want you to take a notice of God’s awesome nature, which is often at display. He takes notice of the minutest of details. He knows what exactly our heart desires! And without us even asking for it, He sets it right before us in due time, processed and packed! And you wouldn’t even realize that it was something that you were wanting so badly … I tell you .. He is lovely! He already is what you wanted your boy friend/ girl friend to be.

for ever, without being caught up in time …

common now… we all know better than that.. Obviously God has chosen an activity for us which will never ever cause us to get tired of, or bored of, but is designed only to increase the joy and peace in our hearts …  its matchless … it can’t even be compared with any activity that you and

title.rendered: #50 Jesus is the Master of all …..

content.rendered:
Inadvertently we all tend to restrict our God to the

Streets of Jerusalem
Miracle/ healing crusades
Alter Calls
Reaching out to non Christians
Financial crisis’
Marriage problems
Baptismal service
Sunday Morning church
Fund raising for a certain Church/ social activity
Fellow ship dinners
Revival meetings
Bible studies
Easter service/ Good Friday service/ Christmas service
Easter Drama practise/ play
Choir

Before getting involved with any of the above, we all seek the Lord’s supervision/ blessings and pray that His will be done – which is wonderful. But the question is, did you seek His help when ….

– you were struggling with some number mismatch in your data analysis and couldn’t figure any way out
– you weren’t getting the right words to draft a decent mail to your boss, reporting your productivity.
– you had no clue how to get together 30 new candidates from the streets for an urgent Ramp up exercises.
– you commit your time to your boss and also your spouse at the same time, without realizing the overlap.
– you couldn’t find the right Job-aids that you required for your process, and were pressurized.
– you had to map, design and develop a new program within a weeks time, but had no clue how to.
– you had to meet a crucial deadline set by the end customer, but the required resources weren’t available.
– you just joined and caused some irreversible damage to the company property.

task:    Wisdom belongs to the Lord !!! Ask for it, so that you may receive it…

content.rendered:
ask yourself these questions…

Is there something that you look forward to everyday ?
Is there something that drives/ inspires/ encourages you to work everyday ?
Is there something/ someone that you long to be with, at your workplace ?
Does that something/ someone ensure you to have a great day at work ?
Does that something/ someone make your day, every day?
Does that something/ someone become your strength when you are losing ground at work ?
Does that something/ someone comfort/ lift up/ massage your spirit, even during times of pressure ?
Does that something/ someone always have a nice word/ beautiful smile for you ?
Does that something/ someone only reminds you of being optimistic and fill you with hope ?

Title: Broken Things
Psalm 51:16,17Psa 51:16 For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it: thou delightest not in burnt offering.

Psa 51:17 The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.
Have you ever studied the broken things in the Bible? A woman broke a vessel at the feet of Jesus and anointed Him. Jesus took bread and broke it as a picture of His body given for us. God uses broken things, and He starts with broken hearts. This is what repentance is all about. God doesn’t listen to the lips. He doesn’t measure a material sacrifice. He looks at the heart and says, “If your heart is broken, then I can cleanse it.”

When David sinned, he could have brought all kinds of sacrifices. But they would not have pleased the Lord. God was waiting for the sacrifice of a broken heart. That’s why David said, “The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit, a broken and a contrite heart–these, O God, You will not despise” (v. 17). David’s sins should have brought him condemnation and death. He committed adultery, and he murdered a man. No sacrifice could be found in God’s sacrificial system for this kind of flagrant, rebellious, deliberate sin. But David did not die. Even though no sacrifice was available for his sin at the time, God looked down the corridors of time and saw a cross where Jesus Christ would die for David’s sin.

God looks at the heart, not the hand. He wants sincerity from the heart, not religious routine. A broken heart is not remorse, nor is it regret. It is repentance, a turning away from sin. It’s telling God you hate sin, are judging it and claiming his forgiveness. Bring to Him the sacrifice of a contrite heart.

title.rendered: The Source of Spiritual Power (Focus: Luke 4:1-14) – Part 1 by David Jackson (A mentor of Pastor Phil)

content.rendered:
Good Morning,

I find Luke’s Gospel to be unique regarding how readers view the humanity of Jesus. The historical account shown in the first three chapters establish the legitimacy of Jesus’ life and work. While on earth, He kept the OT command (Exodus 20:12; Ephesians 6:1-6) -which carried with it the full faith and credit of God, Himself. Jesus obeyed His parents (Luke 2:51). Because He pleased his parents and because He obeyed the law, He was at peace at home and in the community. And what was the result? He grew in influence with God and men (Luke 2:52). Several messages can be written regarding the significance of chapters 1-3, but for brevity sake, I’ll get to my point. Chapter four represents a turning point in the book. From this point, the works of Jesus expand and the ultimate beauty of His final sacrifice necessarily follows His stellar example of daily surrenders.

Luke 4:1 (KJV) 1And Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost returned from Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness

The narrative opens with Jesus preparing for His ministry. The abundance of God’s fullness ruled to the uttermost parts of His humanity. Here He is- being full of God’s Spirit. He had steadily lived His Life in a town that wasn’t big enough for a stop sign, a traffic light, a McDonald’s or a Wal-Mart. Nazareth had small-town, family values- where the water was pure and where everybody knew each other. Nazareth was a hole in the wall- full of nothing special and where simplicity was routine- enough to drive anybody jaded by the night sky of city lights (like me) absolutely crazy. However this was not true of Jesus. This dude was a piece of work. He took advantage of the opportunity and wholeheartedly sought after ways to prepare Himself to do God’s will. He had made a life decision to follow after God and up to this point; Jesus had lived consistently with His decision. Clearly, the fruit of that commitment was evident. I imagine that His homegrown wholesomeness and purity could be reasonably discerned by anyone blessed enough to have met His acquaintance. Nazareth had been an incubator for His strength of spirit, mind, and character. There, Jesus could grow up like any normal Jewish boy without criminal and sinful influences interrupting or interfering with His growth. Nazareth’s proximity to Jordan was more than incidental. During this time, all of Jordan was experiencing a spiritual renewal lead by John the Baptist. No doubt, Jesus attended all of the revival services. As Jesus followed God, one day the Spirit lead Jesus into the wilderness where violence was no longer restrained by the righteousness of a community that restricted the limits of aberrant behavior- like Nazareth had done. God had taken Jesus to the place where it was harsh and where survival of the fittest was the law and controlled the surroundings. In the wilderness, it was every species for itself! Lo and behold, the devil shows up and assaults the stamina and integrity of Christ. Christ maintained his commitment to God through the experience.

Yesterday was Father’s Day, and a child needs to hear the voice of their father. In Matt. 3:17, God the Father said, “This is my Son, whom I love; with Him I am well pleased. In the desert Jesus would cling to the words of His Father and use them at the time the Devil would assault him and attempt to deter Jesus from His mission. It’s amazing that God allows us to place us in life, and along the way He lead us to Him, we received faith in Christ, and one day that faith would be tested. How are you during the wilderness tests in your life? Does your faith in Christ sustain you? What happens when you come through the test? Tomorrow we well look at the result of Jesus’ wilderness test.

title.rendered: Growing In Self Esteem, by Sherry K.George

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Hope you all had a wonderful weekend. Did not get to the office on time to do devotions but I have a devo I received from India. I read it and I was blessed by it, hope you too will; be blessed. Blessings Ev

“Know that the Lord is God. It is He who has made us” (Psalm 100:3)

Most people’s feelings and thoughts about themselves fluctuate some what based on their daily experiences. The grade you get on an exam, how your friends treat you, ups and downs in a romantic relationship-all can have a temporary impact on your wellbeing. Your self-esteem, however, is something more fundamental than the normal “ups and downs” associated with situational changes. For people with good basic self-esteem, normal “ups and downs” may lead to temporary fluctuations in how they feel about themselves, but only to a limited extent. In contrast, for people with poor basic self-esteem, these “ups and downs” may make all the difference in the world.

Where Does Self-Esteem Come From? Our self-esteem develops and evolves throughout our lives as we build an image of ourselves through our experiences with different people and activities. Experiences during our childhood play a particularly large role in the shaping of our basic self-esteem. When we were growing up, our successes (and failures) and how we were treated by the members of our immediate family, by our teachers, coaches, religious authorities, and by our peers, all contributed to the creation of our basic self-esteem. Self-esteem is largely developed during childhood.

Healthy Self-Esteem – Childhood experiences that lead to healthy self-esteem include – Being praised, being listened to, being spoken to respectfully, and getting attention and hugs, experiencing success in sports or school, having trustworthy friends.

Low Self-Esteem – Childhood experiences that lead to low self-esteem include – Being harshly criticized, being yelled at, or beaten, being ignored, ridiculed or teased, being expected to be “perfect” all the time, experiencing failures in sports or school. People with low self-esteem were often given messages that failed experiences (losing a game, getting a poor grade, etc.) were failures of their whole self.

Biblical self esteem consists in seeing ourselves as God sees us, and accepting ourselves as God accepts us. This is founded on the humble acknowledgment that God is responsible for every positive attribute we possess. “Know that the Lord is God. It is He who has made us” (Psalm 100:3). See 1 Corinthians 4:7. This foundation enables us to enjoy and use every good quality, without a trace of pride or false humility, because God receives the glory.

A biblical perspective on our self esteem enables us to see ourselves realistically and accept ourselves as we are both in our human condition and as we are in Christ–new creation .
